item.title: Nuclei flaw lets malicious templates bypass signature verification
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A now-fixed vulnerability in the open-source vulnerability scanner Nuclei could potentially allow attackers to bypass signature verification while sneaking malicious code into templates that execute on local systems. [...]

item.title: Google Chrome is making it easier to share specific parts of long PDFs
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Google is adding the Text Fragment feature to its PDF reader to make it easier to share specific parts of long PDFs. [...]

item.title: New FireScam Android data-theft malware poses as Telegram Premium app
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new Android malware named 'FireScam' is being distributed as a premium version of the Telegram app via phishing websites on GitHub that mimick the RuStore, Russia's app market for mobile devices. [...]

item.title: Bad Tenable plugin updates take down Nessus agents worldwide
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Tenable says customers must manually upgrade their software to revive Nessus vulnerability scanner agents taken offline on December 31st due to buggy differential plugin updates. [...]

item.title: US sanctions Chinese company linked to Flax Typhoon hackers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​The U.S. Treasury Department has sanctioned Beijing-based cybersecurity company Integrity Tech (also known as Yongxin Zhicheng) for its involvement in cyberattacks attributed to the Chinese state-sponsored Flax Typhoon hacking group. [...]

item.title: Malicious npm packages target Ethereum developers' private keys
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Twenty malicious packages impersonating the Hardhat development environment used by Ethereum developers are targeting private keys and other sensitive data. [...]

item.title: Apple offers $95 million in Siri privacy violation settlement
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Apple has agreed to pay $95 million to settle a class action lawsuit in the U.S. alleging that its Siri assistant recorded private conversations and shared them with third parties. [...]

item.title: French govt contractor Atos denies Space Bears ransomware attack claims
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: French tech giant Atos, which secures communications for the country's military and secret services, has denied claims made by the Space Bears ransomware gang that they compromised one of its databases. [...]

item.title: Ransomware gang leaks data stolen in Rhode Island's RIBridges Breach
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The Brain Cipher ransomware gang has begun to leak documents stolen in an attack on Rhode Island's "RIBridges" social services platform. [...]

item.title: New DoubleClickjacking attack exploits double-clicks to hijack accounts
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A new variation of clickjacking attacks called "DoubleClickjacking" lets attackers trick users into authorizing sensitive actions using double-clicks while bypassing existing protections against these types of attacks. [...]

item.title: Chinese hackers targeted sanctions office in Treasury attack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Chinese state-backed hackers have reportedly breached the Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC), a Treasury Department office that administers and enforces trade and economic sanctions programs. [...]

item.title: Over 3 million mail servers without encryption exposed to sniffing attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Over three million POP3 and IMAP mail servers without TLS encryption are currently exposed on the Internet and vulnerable to network sniffing attacks. [...]
